title: Ticket #2892: Shadow, spool_version file approach don't work with multi-schedd setup
description:
I've run in to an issue with the condor_shadow, spool_version file and a multi-schedd setup.

My shadows are failing to run with the error: 

	03/15/12 11:00:55 ERROR "According to /mnt/condor_data/spool/spool_version, the SPOOL directory is written in spool version 0, but I only support versions back to 1.
	" at line 67 in file /home/condor/execute/dir_2782/userdir/src/condor_utils/spool_version.cpp

The condor_config file is vanilla from 7.6.6 save for RELEASE_DIR and LOCAL_DIR being set to my specific locations. The condor_config.local file looks as such: 

	DAEMON_LIST = MASTER
	MASTER.USE_PROCD = True


	SHADOW_LOG = $(LOG)/ShadowLog.$(PID)


	# Define the first SCHEDD on this machine
	SCHEDD1 = $(SCHEDD)
	SCHEDD1_ARGS = -f -local-name Q1
	SCHEDD1_LOG = $(LOG)/ScheddLog.1
	SCHEDD1_SPOOL = $(SPOOL)/1
	SCHEDD.Q1.SCHEDD_NAME = Q1@$(HOSTNAME)
	SCHEDD.Q1.SPOOL = $(SCHEDD1_SPOOL)
	SCHEDD.Q1.SCHEDD_LOG = $(SCHEDD1_LOG)
	SCHEDD.Q1.SCHEDD_ADDRESS_FILE = $(SCHEDD1_SPOOL)/.schedd_address
	SCHEDD.Q1.SCHEDD_DAEMON_AD_FILE = $(SCHEDD1_SPOOL)/.schedd_classad
	SCHEDD.Q1.HISTORY = $(SCHEDD1_SPOOL)/history


	DAEMON_LIST = $(DAEMON_LIST), SCHEDD1
	VALID_SPOOL_FILES = $(VALID_SPOOL_FILES), 1


	# Make the q1@<hostname> schedd the default if the user doesn't use a -name option
	SCHEDD_HOST = Q1@$(HOSTNAME)


	# Define the second SCHEDD on this machine
	SCHEDD2 = $(SCHEDD)
	SCHEDD2_ARGS = -f -local-name Q2
	SCHEDD2_LOG = $(LOG)/ScheddLog.2
	SCHEDD2_SPOOL = $(SPOOL)/2
	SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_NAME = Q2@$(HOSTNAME)
	SCHEDD.Q2.SPOOL = $(SCHEDD2_SPOOL)
	SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_LOG = $(SCHEDD2_LOG)
	SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_ADDRESS_FILE = $(SCHEDD2_SPOOL)/.schedd_address
	SCHEDD.Q2.SCHEDD_DAEMON_AD_FILE = $(SCHEDD2_SPOOL)/.schedd_classad
	SCHEDD.Q2.HISTORY = $(SCHEDD2_SPOOL)/history


	DAEMON_LIST = $(DAEMON_LIST), SCHEDD2
	VALID_SPOOL_FILES = $(VALID_SPOOL_FILES), 2

My LOCAL_DIR layout is: 

	spool/
		1/
			.schedd_address
			.schedd_classad
			job_queue.log
			local_univ_execute
			spool_version
		2/
			.schedd_address
			.schedd_classad
			job_queue.log
			local_univ_execute
			spool_version
	log/
	lock/
	config/
	condor_config.local

If I copy one of those spool_version files to the $(LOCAL_DIR)/spool directory everything works as expected.

Why isn't the SPOOL setting from the multi-schedd propagated to the condor_shadow daemons on startup? They seem to be taking their settings directly from the condor_config/condor_config.local files instead of inheriting the environment the condor_schedd that spawned them. Does the schedd not rewrite the SCHEDD.<name>.SPOOL setting to SPOOL in the environment of sub-processes so they see that specific scheduler's settings at not the (wrong) global settings?

Is there a way to make this happen using the named config syntax?
